Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 148.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Murkowski without amendment. With written report No. 115-111.

DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 381.
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H709-710)

item.title: To designate a mountain in the John Muir Wilderness of the Sierra National Forest as "Sky Point".
To designate a mountain in the John Muir Wilderness of the Sierra National Forest as "Sky Point".

item.name: Introduced in House
item.text: This bill designates a specified mountain in the John Muir Wilderness of the Sierra National Forest in California as "Sky Point."

item.name: Passed House without amendment
item.text:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary has been expanded because action occurred on the measure.)

(Sec. 2) This bill designates a specified mountain in the John Muir Wilderness of the Sierra National Forest in California as "Sky Point."

item.name: Reported to Senate without amendment
item.text:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The expanded summary of the House passed version is repeated here.)

(Sec. 2) This bill designates a specified mountain in the John Muir Wilderness of the Sierra National Forest in California as "Sky Point."

item.name: Passed Senate without amendment
item.text:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The expanded summary of the House passed version is repeated here.)

(Sec. 2) This bill designates a specified mountain in the John Muir Wilderness of the Sierra National Forest in California as "Sky Point."

item.name: Public Law
item.text:

item.name: Wilderness and natural areas, wildlife refuges, wild rivers, habitats

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 163, Number 5 (Monday, January 9, 2017)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. McCLINTOCK:H.R. 381.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article IV, Section 3, Clause 2 (the Property Clause),which confers on Congress the power to make all needful Rulesand Regulations respecting the property belonging to theUnited States.[Page H235]

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
